y", "tests/test_cli_end_to_end.py", "tests/test_end_to_end_plan.py", "tests/test_feasibility_checks.py", "tests/test_id_checker_demo.py", "tests/test_schema_and_provenance.py", "tests/test_validator_smoke.py"]
SUMMARY: Wrote an end-to-end pytest that builds a multi-wave trial plan and asserts required arms, ZPD factors, schedules, mediators/outcomes, causal-chain tests, and logistics are present.

missionDescription: Produce a detailed, mechanism-oriented plan for multi-wave randomized intervention trials that links within-child cognitive growth (executive function and processing speed) to reasoning and real-world decisions via fine-grained social support operationalizations (ZPD: type, timing, fading). The plan should specify experimental arms (nudge/choice-architecture, targeted debiasing, sleep-restoration), measurement schedules for proximal mediators and distal outcomes, causal-chain tests (mediation/moderation), and logistics needed to compare transfer and durability within the same cohorts.
missionSuccessCriteria: Specify at least three fully-specified experimental arms (intervention content, dose, delivery modality) that map to nudge/choice-architecture, targeted debiasing training, and sleep-restoration protocols.

Define a multi-wave measurement schedule (minimum 4 waves) that includes: baseline, immediate post-intervention, short-term follow-up, long-term follow-up, with explicit cognitive mediators (executive-function subtests, processing-speed metrics), ZPD social-support manipulations (type, timing, fading), and at least two policy-relevant distal behavioral endpoints.

Provide a clear analytic strategy to test causal chains and durability: pre-registered mediation/moderation models, sample-size / power heuristics for mediation effects, handling of attrition and missingness, and criteria for establishing broad vs. narrow transfer.

Deliver a concise implementation checklist (recruitment, randomization, fidelity monitoring, measurement instruments, ethical considerations) and a prioritized set of next steps for piloting within 1–2 cohorts.
